page.title: 19Sports and Recreations
page.content: {Shortlanesend}has a playing field for its developing population. It is an area of about 1 hectare managed by {Kenwyn Parish Council.}There is an ad- venture play area and{football}pitch. Nearer the city at Hendra there are the same facilities (Dreadnought) and also an indoor{swimming}pool used, not only by the public, but by the schools in term time with approx.1600 children attending each week. There's a private {squash}court also at Hendra. Other play areas include: Mitchell Hill (3 hectares) and Tregurra (1 hectare). {Carrick Leisure Centre}at Hendra is for indoor sports. At Treliske,{Truro {Golf Club}have their course and{bowls can be played at Kenwyn Road green. {Victoria Gardens}on the slopes of the River Kenwyn provide natural beauty for those less active. Band concerts are held on the ornate bandstand.
